description: I install it on any laptop that I use. I can't stand blueish displays... I use Dispcal with an old Spyder 2 calibration device, yet another example where I am not ditching aged hardware. It took 130 minutes to complete the calibration, much more than with the original software on Windows - I hope the resulting profile is more accurate. I used previous versions, I think over the time the procedure gets more polished (as of 2017, the necessary software, Argyll, is automatically setup and updated by Dispcal). Overall, a very serious piece of software, not far from 5 stars.
summary: Part of my setup every time

description: we use this software for all Machines in our studio in any OS with much better result than commercial software, but you must to know what you are doing
It works with 'sudo apt install python-dbus'
summary: Works on 19.10 but is missing a package

description: very good free tool for calibration
Profiling button disabled. However, seems great if it runs.

I've used DisplayCal for a number of years on various distros to calibrate my systems monitor using a Spyder2 Express.

Now that there is a Flatpak version of DisplayCal, there are less issues with missing dependencies particularly Python2.
I need this all the time

MUCH better than many of the proprietary alternatives out there, DisplayCAL and a colour spectrometer are the only things you need to professionally calibrate your display without needing too much technical know-how
Works perfect and does the job.
Habe meinen Monitor mit DisplayCAL und Spyder 4 Express perfekt kalibrieren können. DisplayCAL ist deutlich genauer/umfangreicher, als das vorinstallierte Tool - sehr zu empfehlen.

Trabajo con colonización en Ubuntu 22.04. Displacall es la única opción de usuario para leer mi dispositivo Spyder 5Pro. Dejó de trabajar en ubuntu 22, lo estaba instalando en Python3 con esta página, https://ignace72.eu/displaycal-en-python-3.html. Hasta que vi otra página que decia que estaba en flatpak, flathub. Que alivio. Gracias.
Me permite calibrar con precision los monitores para poder trabajar con fotografias. No encuentro nada mejor.
